abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment for the
            Uganda Fourth Poverty Reduction Support Credit, which
            improves access to and quality of education, health, water
            and sanitation services, and improves rural services,
            discusses potential, negative environmental impacts and
            measures proposed to mitigate them. They include the
            following: restrict the use of ecologically sensitive areas,
            forest, wetlands, etc., to prevent natural resource
            degradation. Improve soil and water conservation, and
            judiciously apply agricultural inputs. Ensure that
            pesticides are used in accordance with integrated pest
            management principles to offset using increasing quantities
            of agrochemicals in agricultural activities. Observe the
            maximum residue level for commercial crops, and train small
            farmers in storing, handling, and applying agrochemicals, as
            well as crop management. To reduce waste and effluent from
            agro-processing, employ a waste management and environmental
            audit for selected agro-processing facilities. Environmental
            guidelines for road construction and maintenance works will
            be developed and adopted. Improve institutional capacity for
            transportation and environmental management, and train staff
            and contractors. The health care waste strategy (HCW) raises
            awareness; segregates special waste from other waste;
            determines appropriate treatment technology; considers
            facility-based versus disposal options; reduces waste
            generation; monitors infection control and environmental
            protection; uses appropriate technology for packaging,
            transport, treatment, and disposal; develops a HCW
            management plan for facilities; trains health care workers
            in HCW management procedures; and addresses scavenging
            issues. Mitigations applied to water supply and sanitation
            (WSS) will include conducting random/selective environmental
            audits for WSS facilities, and provides awareness training
            for WSS professionals.
